title.narrative: KAPDA Community living dignified life pr

description.narrative:
KAPDA:
The project has three main areas1)access to safe water for both south sudan refugees in Lokori subcounty and other water insecure areas in Kaabong.2)Promotion of peacefull co-existence between the communities in Kaabong and the immigrants fromKenya(the Turkana),3)Increasing community livelihoods by improving animal health conditions. The project also aimed at improving coordination mechanism towards humanitarian response in Kaabong districts As local partners in the humanitarian sector-we are coming together in Kaabong to express interest to build on a case of work in responding to humanitarian emergency in kaabong ,the work we have done overtime with oxfam in the last year,drawing on the learnings and capacity building recived from oxfamsuch as Gender power analysis,influencing ,conflict sensitivity and Cash transfer programming which are critical elements we are adopting to apply in the cosortium. The consortium will comprise of KAPDA, DOCAHWA and MADA.
KAPDA in partnership with DOCAHWA and MADA in this project seek to contribute to addressing the water, conflicts, animal health and livelihood emergencies that are currently taking place in the target areas. The specific interventions that will be done include: 1- Enhance access to water for human consumption and for watering of cattle in the sub-counties of Loyoro, Lodiko and Kamion by rehabilitating 12 boreholes and training 12 water user committees. 2- Facilitating resource conflict resolution meetings among the Turkana, Dodoth and IK communities to facilitate them come up with community supported resolutions. 3- Facilitate the sub-county peace and protection committees to hold 12 awareness raising events on the protection of rights of women and girls. 4- The project will facilitate spot spraying of livestock against tsetse fly and tick borne diseases in Lolelia, Kakamar, Sidok and Loyoro sub-counties. Similarly the project will also facilitate awareness raising events on animal health among pastoralists. 5- The project will provide agric inputs to vulnerable households that were affected by elephant and tsetse fly invasion. Vision of the project: A community of people living a dignified life with resilient livelihoods. Expected outcomes of the project: 1. Access to clean and safe water improved. 2. Improved protection to women and girls among the Turkana, IK andDodoth Pastoralists. 3. Reduced incidences of resource based conflicts among the Turkana, Dodoth and IK communities. 4. Improved animal health and animalhealth services in the target sub-counties.. 5. Improved productivity and production of vulnerable households since the farmers will be putting land on use.

participating-org.narrative:
Karamoja Peace and Development Agency is a local non-governmental organization registered with the National NGO Board with registration number 10635 and with Kaabong District local government and operates mainly in Kotido and Kaabong. Founded in 2005 with the overall goal of #promoting peaceful conflict resolution and restoration of peace in Karamoja in order to enhance sustainable development in Karamoja region and her neighbours, the Head Office is in Kaabong Town Council, Kaabong District, is an active member of the peace actors' networks of local and International agencies and faith based organizations operating in Karamoja in Uganda, Kenya in Turkana and among the Topotha and Didinga of South Sudan. The organization works in collaboration with the District local governments in the region, and belongs to a wider group of networks. Key focus thematic areas of the organization are:
- Food and income security at household level. - Disaster Risk Reduction. - Gender and women empowerment. - Education with focus on primary education, - Good governance.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
